data.meta_description: Vista | 52,855 followers on LinkedIn. Vista is an energy company primarily focused on Vaca Muerta, operating since April 4, 2018 and listed on the Mexican Stock Exchange and the NYSE. The company develops low-cost high-quality assets in Argentina. Its main shale oil development in Vaca Muerta is “Bajada del Palo Oeste”.
data.text:
As energy providers, we have an increasingly challenging task: to provide more affordable and reliable energy to the World’s growing needs, to do so with the lowest emissions possible, and simultaneously decarbonize the energy system as fast as possible. Learn more about our progress in our latest Sustainability Report: https://bit.ly/4cs6YH6

We believe health and safety are the cornerstones to ensure our teams achieve best performance. Therefore, we made it a company priority to provide our people with the highest oil and gas industry standards. Find out more: https://bit.ly/4cs6YH6

We invite you to explore our new Sustainability Report, which highlights our environmental, social, and governance performance in 2023, and outlines our roadmap to achieve our ambitions over the years to come. Read the full report at https://bit.ly/4cs6YH6

Our COO and Co-founder, Juan Garoby, announced the incorporation of a second frac set to enhance efficiency and drive production growth in Vaca Muerta: "The new frac set adds flexibility to accelerate our activity plan."

In only six years, we have achieved a leading position in the development of shale oil in Vaca Muerta. Learn more about our work at vistaenergy.com

“The addition of a third drilling rig will provide us flexibility to accelerate our activity plan in Vaca Muerta. We forecast to put into production between 4 to 8 wells by year-end, in addition to the 46 previously announced.” said our co-founder and COO Juan Garoby during the official contract signing with Nabors Industries.

Our founder and CEO, Miguel Galuccio, announced today that Vista will be accelerating activity in Vaca Muerta by incorporating a third dedicated drilling rig. We expect this could lead to an upward revision of both our activity and production guidance for 2025.

“Our Vista Way” defines us and reflects the values that drive our actions and relationships. “We are a team, relentless to achieve results”. We are a dedicated team of over 400 professionals, united by the belief that collaboration and exceptional performance are the cornerstones of our success.

We achieved a significant milestone in our efforts to reduce carbon emissions in our operations. This accomplishment is not only a major achievement for Vista but also a significant development for the regional energy industry.

“We are on track to double our production to 100,000 barrels of oil equivalent per day by 2026. Our 2024 guidance is the first step in this direction, with a 35% yoy production growth and a 23% yoy Adjusted EBITDA growth," stated Miguel Galuccio, Chairman and CEO, reaffirming what was announced during our last investor day in September 2023. Read the full report at: https://lnkd.in/djsqdNs3
